humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, two sentinel lymph nodes were examined, and one of them was positive for metastatic carcinoma. This corresponds to N1 stage based on the AJCC staging system (New Rule 12). The report also mentions extracapsular extension in the positive lymph node, but this does not affect the N stage in this case.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage is determined by the presence and extent of cancer in the lymph nodes. In this report, the patient has 2 lymph nodes examined, and 1 of them is positive for metastatic carcinoma. The size of the nodal metastasis is 5 mm. This information supports the pathologic N stage of N1.
